title: Will Nathan Chen win a gold medal at the 2018 Winter Olympic Games?
preds: It is over. He did not win a gold.

Chen has been struggling and making big mistakes. His only chance at this point would be for everyone that is currently ahead in points to make a lot of errors and for his skating to be nearly perfect.
The Japanese skater will get it

Winter Olympics: Japan's Yuzuru Hanyu wins men's figure skating title again, as Nathan Chen lands six quads 
http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-17/chens-quad-magic-falls-short-as-hanyu-takes-skating-gold/9458102
Nathan Chen Gets a Different Kind of Reward
Great performance. Result now depends on others mistakes...
Raw talent far superior to any other skater.
Looks like he finally showed up. Still has to rely on others making mistakes to get on the podium, let alone gold.

He got bronze with his team despite what apparently was a bad performance. His performance was tentative and un-impressive today, with a couple of falls. I'm betting he will not be able to turn this around in one day.
He's not looking so hot in his first couple events. Maybe he can turn it around, but its more likely the doubt and pressure will get into his head.

I'll give him slightly better than even odds. If it was to just medal, I'd say the odds were better. But for gold, sometimes the pressure of the world stage has a funny effect on those favored to win.
